comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: This is the best photo I have ever seen of Evers, even if it is a tad underexposed.  If he played today, he would never make the Hall of Fame.  However, players are chosen as to how they performed versus their peers, and he was a great second baseman, better than Fred Merkle, he of boner fame, from the NY Giants.

comment.author: 94165841@N00
comment._content: Sad that the cubbies hadn't won a very recent World Series, even when he was playing.

comment.author: 23582291@N03
comment._content: Pineapple, Johnny Evers played for the Cubs from 1902 to 1913, including both years they won the World Series (1907and 1908).

comment.author: 7608487@N05
comment._content: Wow!  I love the DOF.  This is great.

comment.author: 28039459@N08
comment._content: This is the Evers of "Tinker to Evers to Chance" fame from the baseball poem, "Baseball's Sad Lexicon" by Franklin Pierce Adams.(1910)
